Label: plant growth cycle
Text definition: A whole plant development stage that begins with seed germination or exit from dormancy, ends with death or entry into dormancy, and during which the participant plant is not dormant.
Subclass of: 'whole plant development stage' AND ('starts with' SOME ('seed germination' OR 'exit from dormancy')) AND ('precedes' SOME ('entry into dormancy' OR 'death stage')")"""
Comments: This class is not intended to apply to in vitro-grown plants such as tissue culture, where growth can begin with cell division.

Label: initial growth cycle
Text definition: A plant growth cycle that begins with seed germination.
Equivalent to: 'plant growth cycle' THAT 'starts with' SOME 'seed germination'

Label: later growth cycle
Text definition: A plant growth cycle that begins with exit from dormancy of the participating plant. This cycle cannot begin with the exit from dormancy of a seed.
Subclass of: 'plant growth cycle' THAT 'starts with' SOME 'exit from dormancy'

Label: plant regreening process
Notes: Need to request this in GO.

Label: phenology observing process
Text definition: An observing process that has as input a portion of a plant or a whole plant and has as output a measurement datum that is a quality datum of some plant phenological trait.
Subclass of: 'observing process' AND ('has_specified_input' SOME ('portion of a plant' OR 'whole plant')) AND ('has_specified_output' SOME ('measurement datum' THAT 'quality datum of' SOME 'plant phenological trait'"))"""

Label: vascular leaf unfolding stage
Text definition: A vascular leaf expansion stage during which a vascular leaf participates in the process of unfolding.
Comments: This stage ends when a leaf is considered unfolded, which varies by species, but generally occurs once the leaf blade has unfolded enough to appear more or less like a small version of the adult leaf. For species with scaled buds, this is generally once the entire leaf blade has emerged from a breaking bud; for conifers, once a needle begins to spread away at an angle from the developing stem or from other needles in a bundle (e.g. pines); for grasses, once the leaf blade unrolls slightly from around the stem and begins to fall away at an angle; for sedges, once the leaf has grown long enough that the two halves of the blade have begun to spread apart like an open book; for rushes, once the exposed, green portion of the leaf has reached a specified length.
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: vascular leaf expanding unfolded stage
Text definition: A vascular leaf expansion stage during which a vascular leaf has completed the process of unfolding but is still expanding in size.
Comments: This stage begins when a leaf is considered unfolded, which varies by species, but generally occurs once the leaf blade has unfolded enough to appear more or less like a small version of the adult leaf. For species with scaled buds, this is generally once the entire leaf blade has emerged from a breaking bud; for conifers, once a needle begins to spread away at an angle from the developing stem or from other needles in a bundle (e.g. pines); for grasses, once the leaf blade unrolls slightly from around the stem and begins to fall away at an angle; for sedges, once the leaf has grown long enough that the two halves of the blade have begun to spread apart like an open book; for rushes, once the exposed, green portion of the leaf has reached a specified length.
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: vascular leaf expanded immature stage
Comments: In this stage, the leaf is fully expanded but not yet the same color and texture as fully mature leaves.
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: vascular leaf mature stage
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: unopened flower stage
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: open flower stage
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: pollen-releasing flower stage
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: fruit unripe stage
Text definition: A fruit ripening stage in which the ripening fruit has not yet reached the fruit ripe stage.

Label: fruit ripe stage
Text definition: A fruit ripening stage in which the ripening fruit has completed ripening to the taxon-specific point at which it is widely considered by botanical experts to have seeds $seed that are developed enough to be ready for dispersal, or, in the case of agricultural crops, the point at which the fruit is considered palatable for human consumption.

Label: strobilus development stage
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: open microsporangiate strobilus stage
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: pollen-releasing strobilus stage
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: megasporangiate strobilus unripe stage
Text definition: A megasporangiate strobilus ripening stage in which the ripening seed cone has not yet reached the megasporangiate strobilus ripe stage.

Label: megasporangiate strobilus ripe stage
Text definition: A megasporangiate strobilus ripening stage in which the ripening seed cone has completed ripening to the taxon-specific point at which it is widely considered by botanical experts to have seeds $seed that are developed enough to be ready for dispersal.
